column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Make a Walking Robot
#Text=If you want to make a robotic animal a four legged walking robot is a good place to start .
#Text=This DIY robot can be made out of a sheet of polycarb or other durable material , small machine screws , small eye screws , rubber bands , string , batteries , and a dc motor .
#Text=This project will require some electronics experience .
#Text=These directions are just a place to start , you can make adjustments as you go .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Cut polycarb into multiple one centimeter wide strips
#Text=Cut strips into 8-7 cm pieces , 4-3 cm pieces , 2-10 cm pieces , 2-5 cm pieces and 4-4 cm pieces .
#Text=Drill holes slightly larger than your string in both ends of the 3 cm pieces and in the middle of 4 of the 7 cm pieces ( thigh )
#Text=In the same 4 1x7 cm pieces ( thigh ) , in one corner cut diagonally from halfway across the short side to 1 cm up the long side .
#Text=Choose a drill bit that would allow your machine screws move freely through the hole but not wobble .
#Text=In the same 4 pieces ( thigh ) drill holes 1.5 cm from both sides
#Text=In the other 4 1x7 pieces ( calf ) drill holes 0.5 cm from one end
#Text=Use 4 machine screws to attach , but do not tighten , each type of 1x7 pieces ( thigh and calf ) with the diagonal cut in the center
#Text=Using super glue , glue the 1x3 cm pieces on the calf so the long edge lines up with the end of the thigh piece , this should be 3 cm from the edge .
#Text=The legs should be able to move freely in one direction , similar to a person 's leg .
#Text=To make feet :
#Text=cut 8 4x2 cm pieces with a slight curve in one of the long sides
#Text=glue one to the end of each leg with the curve down
#Text=use machine screws with multiple nuts on them to connect the other foot pieces so there is a space between them , they should be able to stand on their own

#Text=At the top of your legs , 0.5 cm from the edge , drill a hole that your eye screw will tightly slide into then with a slightly smaller drill bit drill holes 1 cm from the ends of the 1x10 cm pieces(body ) .
#Text=Use the eye screws to attach each leg to the body , they should move freely and all knees should be facing one direction .
#Text=Modify two servo motors
#Text=remove the 4 screws holding it together
#Text=remove electrical components
#Text=unclip potentiometer
#Text=remove foam block
#Text=put everything except the potentiometer and foam block back together
#Text=Using more strips of polycarb attach the motors to the underside of the body in the center .
#Text=Add the round gear accessory to the servo and place eye screws at the top and bottom of the motors
#Text=Drill a hole for a machine screw 0.5 cm from the end on one side of the 1x4 cm pieces , on the other side drill a hole for a eye screw 0.5 cm from the end
#Text=With a machine screw attach one 1x4 cm piece to the remaining large holes in each leg .
#Text=Use a eye screw to attach the other end to an off center hole in the gear of the motor , both pieces should be stacked on the same screw .
#Text=Cut a rubber band and run it through the hole in the 1x3 piece that is in the front , and the remaining small hole in the thigh , tie so the leg stays straight , and repeat for all the legs .

#Text=Tie the string to the eye screw connected to the motor , run it through the eye screw above the motor , through the eye screw at the top of the back leg , and tie the other end to the other hole in the 1x3 piece , make sure the string is tight enough that it just barely starts to pull on the leg when the leg is all the way back .
#Text=Repeat using the eye screw above the motors for back legs and the eye screw below the motors for front legs
#Text=Glue the 1x5cm pieses to the front and back of the body pieces to connect both sides
#Text=Connect a battery holder to the motors
#Text=Add rubber bands to feet for traction as needed
#Text=Tips
#Text=You can skip step 10 and use another dc motor but servo motors have convenient housings and accessories .
